channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Montrose Avenue southside, 13th November
item.description:
There is a pile-up of unswept fallen leaves on the pavement and in the kerb area of the road which really need to be swept more often than fortnightly in the autumn/winter months. Neighbouring roads like Kingswood Ave are getting swept once a week. The build-up of unswept leaves is turning sticky with the rain and pressure of pedestrian traffic, and presents a slip hasard to users. Even when the pavement is swept, a residue of sticky, congealed leaves is left, and this accumulates. Similarly the kerbs are often not swept due to parked cars, and this accumulates in the same way. Kindly issue sweepers with stiff brooms so the sticky residue can be removed. Thank you.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Montrose Avenue, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lights not working on a pedestrian/cyclist bridge over Ravensbourne River (near River Mill Park), 13th November
item.description:
The lights has not been working on a pedestrian/cyclist bridge over Ravensbourne River (near River Mill Park) for a long time. This is extremely unsafe at night.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elder Walk, Ladywell, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Anti social behaviour in stairwells ( Chilton Grove), 13th November
item.description:
A group of up to 20 teenagers loiter in the stairwells and by lift entrances most evenings and smoke marijuana and are very noisy, as well as blocking stairwells and entrances to lift with bikes. These people do not even live in building. With elderly people living on balcony and trying to sleep, even worried about going out and using lift/ stairs. Continous nuisance and leave lots of litter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70-136, Chilton Grove, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights and no work being done, 13th November
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights blocking off a completely clear bit of busy road. They have been there all day yet no work done at all. Are they just there to cause congestion? That is all they are achieving!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146-148, Park View Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fast flowing water out of gully, 13th November
item.description:
Fast flowing water out of gully flooding Salter's Hill and Central Hill. Source near to 22 Salter's Hill, SE19 1DZ Thames Water refuse to attend as say Local Authority has responsibility for gullies. Multiple gullies down Hill now blocked with grit and debris adding to flooding. Central Hill and Salter's Hill junction now flooded on a steep hill. Extremely slippy and is dangerous for mopeds, motorcycles and cycles. Urgent action is needed and appropriate authority escalated to address , and before freezing wintery connections

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 28, Salters Hill, West Norwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazardous Rubbish dumping, 13th November
item.description:
This area has become a regular dumping spot despite previous reports to the council. There is now a TV on the pavement posing a safety hazard to pedestrians. It was originally on the opposite side of the road, blocking pavement access. Please could someone arrange for it to be removed as soon as possible? It was already reported this morning through the council website, yet no action has been taken The ongoing fly-tipping here has been an issue for over a month, and the street is not being cleaned regularly. Itâ€™s disrespectful to residents and unsafe,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Merrow Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet
